El mejor juego que he jugado nunca en mi vida, una narrativa espectacular, una jugabilidad fantastica, y que decir de la historia, en ningun momento se te hace pesada ni lenta, este juego es obligatorio jugarlo, le puede competir a cualquier juego de la actualidad el dia que quieras, te encari√±as con los personajes, hasta con G-Man xd, y para ponerle la cereza al pastel, su final es abierto, es simplemente perfecto.

Half-Life 2 is easily one of my favorite games and one of the best games of all time. I'm not going to go into detail about the story because you have definetly heard it by now, all you need to know is that the story is fantastic. The graphics, be it that they are quite old, hold up pretty well (in my opinion). HL2 is one of the few games I can go back to whenever I'm bored and will never get tired of it. I reccommend getting episodes 1 and 2 as well. The only bad thing about this game is the cliffhanger at the end of episode 2. I EXTREMELY reccommend this game, but you do not want to be left with a gigantic cliffhanger I suggest you go somewhere else. 11/10 must buy

Welcome, welcome to city 17. you have chosen, or have been chosen, to relocate to this review of Half life 2! Let me take you on the wonderful journey that is the Half Life series. Half life started out life as a blatant rip-off of Quake, and later evolved into a blatant rip-off of Quake, but with a story! Released in 1998, head CEO "Grape" newell shook the gaming industry forever. Innovative, Fast-paced action, Realistic shooting physics, and even the General man(Formally known as the G-man)! Half life was truly unique and amassed a extremely large fan base. Wanting to innovate and shake up the gaming world once more, Mr.newman summoned his team of experts to make a sequel, Half life 2! Half life 2 (also known as "Half life 2nd) was a cult classic amongst gamers world wide! Innovating and remastering the previous title by a landslide. In the rough and tumble world of Half life, You (Chell fryman) and your oriental girlfriend Alyx jones, travel the world playing Dayz and fighting characters from metro2033. The story starts off where the previous game left off, You must work your way through apocalyptic russia, all the way to the united states to kill president George bush. Who is plotting to send Americans to a second iraq war and nuke everyone with a big crystal. As you work your way to the big metal spike in the ground with the help of The General(man), you reach the final level, a 1v30 death-match against George bush, his nudist henchmen, and the Neapolitan police force. miraculously coming out unscathed you finally reach George soros, promptly throwing a grenade at him, blowing him to smithereens. Right as this happens, The General cuts to commercial break to sell you car insurance before leaving the stage, and ending the game. Half life 2 was well received among many, so well received that Grape Newell, eager to please his fans, promised 3 (later only able to deliver on 1 of these promises) dlc maps for Half life 2 for the Gameboy Advanced. The first dlc to come was kinda poop lol, but the second dlc lived up to the franchises name. All of this wore down Mr.newell, he became a very tired man. Mr.newell has since won a guiness book of world record title for "Longest time asleep on a couch"(7 years). He (Grape newman) now spends his time lounging around in his office watching people spend $400 on skins while jacking off. Half life 2 is still the worlds best videogame forever and ever, easily surpassing methestas "skyrime". Half life 3 wont happen, but at least we have hentai vr games. Thanks Grape.

5/7
One of the best FPS's I've played, and one of the best games I've ever known of.

I wanted to make this review short and sweet, but it's hard to stop writing, even when excluding facts that could potentially contaminate an exceptionally well thought-out gaming experience. There's just so much to say. Half-Life 2 is, simply put, the best single-player shooter ever released for the PC. It does so many things right in so many ways that it might be possible to write a thesis on the topic of Half-Life 2 compared to other single player shooters. What Valve has created is simply a masterpiece -- a work of art in the genre. Not only does it engage the mind with mysterious happenings, vagaries, and mostly intelligent dialogue, but also captures the senses with a superb visual style made possible by brilliant technology. And once the initial shock of it all wears off and it becomes possible to peel back the polished layers of sight and sound, there is an excellent shooter here. Half-Life 2 doesn't do anything particularly new; it doesn't really innovate in many ways. But what it does is set a new height for all other designers of first-person shooters to reach. It still isn't exactly perfect, but it's about as close as I've seen in my tenure here.

Before I really get into the review, you should know the background of how this game was reviewed. Valve did not want to send out copies of their game (for fairly obvious reasons) before it was released to the public. In order to play the game, I, and several of my colleagues throughout the industry, took a trip up to Seattle to visit Valve in order to have some private time with the title. I was given a little room to myself where I could close the door, turn off the lights, click my little red slippers, and pretend that I was sitting at home. It worked for the most part, largely because I was so engrossed with the game that when I came out of my trance I often had to take a moment to get my bearings. Obviously, Valve was happy to bring me into a controlled environment for ideal playing conditions.

One of my favorite FPSes surely, and I actually prefer this over HL1, though if asked Black Mesa vs HL2, I might have trouble deciding which I like better. But HL1 vs 2? I like 2 better.

The good:

Atmosphere. Premise is a post-apocalyptic dystopian oppressive regime, run by an alien Cyborg race that loots planets for resources. Fantastic mood this game got. Police brutality, a small bastion of mankind alive fighting desperately against the Combine, decayed scenery, etc.

Gunplay. I've heard people bash HL2 gunplay for not being enough over-the-top beefy or whatever. But I can't say it's weak nor unsatisfying? Weapons shake your view in a smooth, non-robotic and sharp manner. Sounds are nice, I love rampaging with the MP7 for example, lovely shot sound. Crossbow makes a nice low-pitch twang. Combines' Pulse Rifle has a nice bass-heavy sound. And this time around, the shotgun all in all truly feels proper.

Vehicle manned sequences. You get to drive an airboat and a dune buggy, both which are armed, and you'll get to war in vehicular combat against the Combine.

The new weapons. Play the game to find out..!

You get to command squads of human soldiers.

New enemies.

The Gravity Gun. Just dammit, what an awesome weapon, not only is it's one purpose to return a tipped-over Buggy back to it's wheels, it can also be used to grab and launch any light-enough object as a projectile, to either save ammo or just have sadistic fun.

The bad:

Combines' AI kind of feels to be a bit lacking.
The beat sequel to half life I could ever ask for.

Half-Life 2 set the standard for how shooter games should be. They should have a good story and characters while also having good gameplay. This one achieves that. Too bad most other shooters only focus on the gameplay aspect... Oh well. At least Half-Life 2 is good.

Pretty good game. Played it again for about the 4th time or so and wanted to give a better review.

On normal mode, combat's alright and the enemies can hurt you quite a bit. Weapons are nice, although I found that the revolver wasn't really as good as I thought it was previously. It has a low ammo count with ammo for it being generally uncommon and the crossbow just replaces it as the token long range power weapon. Or short range power weapon. The crossbow's pretty strong.

Anyway, yeah. Really nice game. If you haven't played it before, I'd say check it out. If you really like it, then try out the original (Buy the source version if you can't run the goldsource engine original version) as well as the episodes. Also a quick tip, Dog's ball can be used as an easier way to get the Ravenholm gravity gun only achievement (It can crush headcrabs, distract enemies, and can be shot at enemies for a kill).

Do I even need to say anything about this?

It's practically a masterpiece of it's time. While it hasn't aged perfectly, it's still a decent FPS game today. It was a giant influence on the FPS genre in it's day, and often still is. Incredible graphics for 2004 and amazing gunplay. Story is very good, however it was never officially concluded and may never be.

Very recommended, not only because it's a good game but because it's like reflecting on classic art and music and how they affected their individual media.
